item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 29, 2025 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Why Apple's Severance gets edited over remote desktop software (169 points | 106 comments)
2. Veloren – voxel action-adventure role-playing in Rust (91 points | 13 comments)
3. Accessible open textbooks in math-heavy disciplines (91 points | 29 comments)
4. Paged Out #6 is out (52 points | 4 comments)
5. Vramfs: Vram Based Filesystem for Linux (50 points | 11 comments)
6. Show HN: Physical Pomodoro Timer with ESP32 and e-paper screen (253 points | 59 comments)
7. Matrix Calculus (For Machine Learning and Beyond) (3 points | discuss)
8. Real Time Chess – A physical chess board without the concept of turns (137 points | 20 comments)
9. The Candid Naivety of Geeks (3 points | discuss)
10. When the physicists need burner phones, that's when you know America's changed (139 points | 98 comments)
11. Lvgl: Embedded graphics library to create beautiful UIs (5 points | discuss)
12. OSS-SEC: Three bypasses of Ubuntu's unprivileged user namespace restrictions (6 points | discuss)
13. Free Output – AI output copyright status checker (12 points | 5 comments)
14. Postgres Language Server: Initial Release (237 points | 37 comments)
15. Typed Japanese (45 points | 10 comments)
16. Show HN: I implemented Snake in a tmux config file (26 points | 1 comment)
17. Plain – a web framework for building products with Python (251 points | 144 comments)
18. We hacked Gemini's Python sandbox and leaked its source code (at least some) (613 points | 125 comments)
19. The Wrong Way to Use a Signed Distance Function (SDF) (3 points | discuss)
20. Utah becomes first US state to ban fluoride in its water (7 points | 4 comments)
21. TSMC, Intel and other top chipmakers slow Japan, Malaysia expansions (24 points | 6 comments)
22. Portlander creates AI-powered device to monitor street health (8 points | 1 comment)
23. Chimpanzees act as 'engineers', choosing materials to make tools (84 points | 57 comments)
24. I don't think I can trust Google as my search engine anymore (9 points | 11 comments)
25. Making of the New York and Erie Railroad Organizational Diagram (3 points | discuss)
26. Rubik's Cube Solutions, Puzzles, and 8-Balls (2023) (20 points | 4 comments)
27. Low responsiveness of ML models to critical or deteriorating health conditions (72 points | 42 comments)
28. Body Doubling (16 points | discuss)
29. Mathematical Compact Models of Advanced Transistors [pdf] (73 points | 19 comments)
30. "Station" by Mitsuo Isaka (1994) (3 points | discuss)
